Interesting data doesn't live inside R. Lets get data from an external file into R, and learn how to make more complex plots. 


`r emo::ji("memo")` Prepare:

* Right click each link and save the following data sets **into the `data` subfolder in your MATH130 folder**. 

`r emo::ji("sign")` **DO NOT RENAME ANYTHING** If you download multiple copies of the data, do not keep the versions that have a (1) or some number in the name. Do not leave these files in your downloads folder. 


* [NCBirths](https://norcalbiostat.netlify.com/data/NCbirths.csv)
* [email](https://norcalbiostat.netlify.com/data/email.txt)
* [Police Shootings](https://norcalbiostat.netlify.com/data/fatal-police-shootings-data.xlsx)
